title: gaining 13lp and then losing 20+ WTF
body: ok so im your average bronzie, b4 to be exact, me and my m8z also bronze have been doing some dynamo q. when we win which is quite often my friends gain about 20lp and im only gaining between 10 and 13, this would be fine but everytime i lose a game i lose around 23lp, so with this in mind i have to have a 75% winrate in order to climb at all. this doesnt jsut happen when i duo but when i play alone aswell. i am aware if i have higher mmr than my team i will gain less lp but im in bronze so.... kappa. can a rito dorito explain this pls. much love cy@, ydb

replies.body: ok but i have higher mr than the average in my league, so shouldnt it even out?

unfortunately quite the opposite. If you want to climb quickly, having a low mmr compared to your teammates gives you more lp but also is counteracted by your mmr rising quickly to match it. So long as you keep winning consecutively on a new account, it's possible to ride this wave up pretty high in terms of elo but eventually as your winrate evens out as games get harder the flow ebbs.
Yeah your mmr is like bronze 2 at the moment which means the climb is going to be slow, especially since you'll be matched with other bronze 4 players and they'll have lower mmr than yours. This is why it takes more time to climb when in low elo and in high elo as well. It's to do with the way lp works and the standard bell curve.

>The (presumed, not official basics).

>You win games, your MMR goes up
You lose games, your MMR goes down
MMR determines who you are matched against (mmr= match making rating)
You win against a team with more MMR than yours, maybe you get more LP (and vice versa).

Generally, if you have a low win rate (yours is currently at 44%, you will have pretty bad MMR and will be losing more LP than you are gaining. At around 50% win rate is where it starts to even out. 

[Your mates probably have better MMR than you. ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ#h2q3)
